programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A hiker leads intelligence to a young woman being held captive in the woods near Chicago; a former relationship of Halstead's comes back into the picture, much to the surprise of Lindsay.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The investigation leads Intelligence to one of Chicago's wealthiest families after a nighttime photographer is murdered over a piece of mysterious footage; Burgess' sister Nicole visits the district and presents an icy attitude toward Ruzek.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When Burgess realizes that her sister, Nicole, never made it home after a night out with friends, the members of the intelligence team make finding Nicole their top priority.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The murder weapon in the killing of a teenage boy is linked to a case Voight worked on 17 years ago; the victim's father wants Area Central Homicide to take the case.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Intelligence investigates armed bank robberies, which point to some surprising suspects; Lindsay is forced to make a decision in the heat of the moment.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A vigilante posts a video online of a man, previously locked up for statutory rape, being beaten and burned alive; Lindsay encounters some personal and professional problems.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike can't wait to hit the open road and go bass fishing with Skip. The first stop on their trip is Lou's bar. A pleasant morning turns into a dangerous afternoon when Hammer realizes that a team of violent bank robbers is sitting at the next table. The situation spirals and after a shoot out that leaves Grady wounded, the volatile men and their lingerie-clad femme fatale hold everyone in the bar hostage. Now, Hammer must keep everyone safe and stop the criminals, all without his gun.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: The former secretary of an old friend, Simon, visits Mike Hammer with a theory about her old boss's sudden death. Mike chalks up her death to Simon's adventurous streak, until he shows up alive in his apartment. Simon reveals how he continued to play dead after a hired assassin took shots at him and two other hunting buddies. Looking for revenge, Simon talks Mike into helping him track down his assassin, and hunt that takes the private eye all the way to California. However, Mike soon after meets danger on this journey.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: After failing to save a tobacco company scientist scheduled to testify in court, Mike Hammer decides to quit smoking. However, a clean lifestyle becomes harder than he thought when he follows up on his client's murder. The dead scientist leaves behind questions about the killer's motives, his work at the company, and the tobacco industry at large. Of course, the nicotine withdrawals don't seem to help.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A news reporter's murder leads to an investigation into Libya's rebel movement; Hetty reveals information about Callen's past.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The LAPD asks NCIS for help when a case exposes a link between a Mexican drug cartel and a terrorist.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: After a former Navy intelligence officer is murdered, the team's investigation reveals she was living a double life.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team must establish whether a dishonorably discharged Marine committed a murder or is being framed.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: When a Navy ID is found on a body linked to a hazardous material smuggling case, the team goes to Mexico to investigate and search for the missing materials.

programme.desc: While running a secret errand, Dawson finds herself trapped in a collapsed parking structure; pressure mounts on Casey as he begins taking on additional duties; Kidd grows increasingly skeptical of Hope.

programme.desc: Casey and Severide find themselves at odds after Casey argues about how to save a teenager entangled in barbed wire; Otis tries to convince Casey to participate in the beta test for an expensive piece of new firefighting equipment.

programme.desc: Kidd is surprised to discover she is being transferred out of the firehouse; Severide and Casey are suspicious and investigate; Otis and Herrmann discuss taking over a rundown bar; Dawson's frustration with her father reaches a boiling point.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Dawson asks Severide for help; Brett and Kidd compete for Zach's heart; Otis, Herrmann and Mouch try to figure out the source of a terrible stench wafting throughout the firehouse.

programme.desc: Dawson and Casey try to find Bria's whereabouts; Lt. Severide reunites with Chief Grissom; Cruz enlists the help of Brett and Mouch to create a new tool; Kidd and Zach go on a date.

programme.desc: Chief Boden unwillingly agrees to let Dawson and Brett go under cover; Kidd and Zach's relationship hits a bump; Cruz has a hard time expressing his true feelings for Brett.

programme.desc: Otis and Kidd's lives are put in jeopardy when there's gunfire inside a house; Dawson comforts Brett during an especially trying time; Casey begins to notice that romance might be going on within the firehouse.

programme.desc: The crew struggles to come to terms with an injury to one of their own; a temporary replacement must be dealt with; Boden ponders some interesting news; Kidd has a hard time keeping a secret.

programme.title: Chicago Fire

programme.desc: Grover's parents and brother arrive in Oahu for Thanksgiving; a thief is crushed to death by an empty safe.

programme.desc: A man living a double life with two separate families is murdered; Erin asks Anthony to help investigate his former partner; Frank deliberates between two candidates for the chief of transit position.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny forces his brother-in-law to help Baez take down the mobsters he's mixed up with; Frank suspects his old partner is guilty of a crime; Jamie is approached by an officer who wants help getting reassigned from his undercover assignment.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A woman voices outrage over her son's unsolved murder; Danny re-examines the case; Eddie gets shot while on duty; Erin and her ex-husband face off in court; Frank deals with an angry police force after the mayor fails to defend it.

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.desc: Frank locks horns with a data-tracking company when it refuses to unlock a terrorist's phone that may hold information regarding upcoming targets; Erin obtains information about an impending murder from a shady source; a woman kidnaps a baby.

programme.title: 24 Hours to Kickoff: Buffalo Bills
programme.desc: Everything that goes into preparing the Bills stadium for a crazy weather game.

programme.title: Condensed Game
programme.desc: MVP Candidate: Joe Burrow threw two touchdown passes and Cincinnati's defense swarmed Josh Allen on a snow-slicked field in a 27-10 win Sunday to send the Bengals to the AFC championship game for the second straight year.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: LeSean McCoy scores on a 21-yard run in overtime to secure the Buffalo Bills' 13-7 win over the Indianapolis Colts in the Week 14 "Snow Game" during the 2017 NFL season.

programme.title: Condensed Game
programme.desc: Jimmy Graham caught a 15-yard touchdown pass from Foles with 1:01 remaining, Damiere Byrd made an acrobatic reception for the 2-point conversion, and the Chicago Bears beat the Seattle Seahawks 25-24 during the snowy matchup.

programme.title: The Timeline
programme.desc: The story behind the controversial play call that secured a playoff victory for the Patriots in a season that ended with a New England Super Bowl win.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Patriots would meet the Raiders in the Divisional Round of the AFC Playoffs and the New England victory was fueled by the controversial Tuck Rule, which consequently launched the Patriots into a dynasty.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Miami Dolphins and Dallas Cowboys face off in a snowy Thanksgiving showdown that goes down to the final possessions.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Browns running back Nick Chubb scored a 2-yard, go-ahead touchdown with 57 seconds left, and Steelers quarterback Russell Wilson's Hail Mary attempt was batted down in the end zone as time expired as Cleveland wins in the snow 24-19 over Pittsburgh.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Josh Allen tallies a passing, rushing and receiving touchdown on his stat sheet as the Bills rout the 49ers 35-10 in snow, and clinch AFC East.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Saquon Barkley dashed through the snow for two touchdown runs and finished with 205 yards rushing, Jalen Hurts had a 44-yard scoring run and the Eagles held on against the turnover-happy Rams 28-22 on Sunday to reach the NFC championship game.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Christian Benford intercepted Joe Burrow's toss and returned it 63 yards for a go-ahead touchdown with 5:25 left, Josh Allen threw for 3 touchdowns and ran in another, and the Buffalo Bills beat the Cincinnati Bengals 39-34 on a snowy Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs

programme.title: Fox College Football - Big Ten: Ohio St. at Michigan
programme.desc: Bitter Big Ten rivals in the Buckeyes (11-0, 8-0) and Wolverines (9-2, 7-1) line up for the Big Game for the 121st time. Michigan leads the series 62-52-6 after winning the last four engagements, including a 13-10 stunner in 2024.

programme.title: Fox College Football - Mountain West Championship: UNLV vs Boise St.
programme.desc: Boise State faces UNLV for the third straight time in the Mountain West Conference title game. The six-time MWC champion Broncos beat the Rebels 44-20 in 2023, and 21-7 in 2024. UNLV quarterback Anthony Colandrea has created 30 TDs this season.

programme.title: Fox College Football - Big Ten Championship: Indiana vs Ohio St.
programme.desc: The nation's only two undefeated programs face off in the Big Ten championship game as Indiana plays Ohio State for the CFP's top seed. The Buckeyes seek a record 25th outright conference crown. The Hoosiers have not won a title since 1967.

programme.title: Fox College Football - Big Ten: Ohio St. at Michigan
programme.desc: Bitter Big Ten rivals in the Buckeyes (11-0, 8-0) and Wolverines (9-2, 7-1) line up for the Big Game for the 121st time. Michigan leads the series 62-52-6 after winning the last four engagements, including a 13-10 stunner in 2024.

programme.title: Fox College Football - Mountain West Championship: UNLV vs Boise St.
programme.desc: Boise State faces UNLV for the third straight time in the Mountain West Conference title game. The six-time MWC champion Broncos beat the Rebels 44-20 in 2023, and 21-7 in 2024. UNLV quarterback Anthony Colandrea has created 30 TDs this season.

programme.title: Fox College Football - Big Ten Championship: Indiana vs Ohio St.
programme.desc: The nation's only two undefeated programs face off in the Big Ten championship game as Indiana plays Ohio State for the CFP's top seed. The Buckeyes seek a record 25th outright conference crown. The Hoosiers have not won a title since 1967.

programme.desc: The fists fly as Bobby Henry collides with Kasey Yates, Will Albrecht battles Kyle McElroy, and Felipe Chavez squares off against Brandon Honsvick in an all-action night of bare-knuckle warfare.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: The best of bare knuckle fight action with Justin Sanchez vs Gilberto Aguilar, Rene Rodriguez vs Mark Johnson, and topped off with flyweight Chancey Wilson fighting Tyler Randall.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Featherweights Howard Davis and Trevor Morris enter the squared circle, then Stephen 'Tomahawk' Townsel takes on Chris Sarro, and Gee 'The Cutman' Perez fights Josh Richey in a crowd thriller.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: The UK is in the house. Rico Franco and Axel Birbes, Franco Tenaglia vs Luke Nevis, and finishes off with an epic headliner between Danny Christie vs Anthony Holmes.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: The best of bare knuckle fighting featuring Jonny Graham vs. Will Carns, Tom Scott vs. Damian Gorski, and finishing with Conor Cooke fighting Robbie Kennedy.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Carlos Trinidad-Snake battles Elvin Brito, followed by Alonzo Martinez vs. Jeremy Sauceda in an epic battle, and wraps up with Sean Wilson vs. Brandon Meyer in a crazy knucklefest.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Featuring Bryce Henry vs. Billy Wagner, Lloyd Mix trades hands with Dallas Davidson, and the first ever BKFC featherweight title fight pits Kai Stewart against Louie Lopez.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: Watch a replay of the second Friday Night Poker cash game! Bryn Kenney, Lauren Roberts, Jamie Kerstetter, Alan Richardson, Ken Kohl, and Tia Kajah headline an entertaining and action-packed $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action and Daniel Negreanu makes a guest appearance!

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 1
programme.desc: The first of three festive Poker After Dark nights headlined by Phil Hellmuth featured jolly $10000 Sit & Go! Rewatch the full show as Hellmuth took on Maria Ho Antonio Esfandiari Mike Matusow Dan Shak and Randall Emmett.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 2
programme.desc: The festivities continue on Holidays with Hellmuth as Phil takes on all comers in this $100/$200 cash game. Rewatch the whole show now as he goes up against Dan Shak Brian Potashnik David 'Doc' Sands Avi Freedman and Rick Thompson.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 1A of the 2004 WSOP Main Event is underway with Daniel Negreanu, Men "The Master" Nguyen, and John Hennigan on the feature table. Defending champion Chris Moneymaker kicks off his title defense, while several big names find themselves heading home early.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Coverage continues on Day 1B of the WSOP Main Event, and last year's runner-up Sammy Farha headlines the feature table along with John Juanda. Chris Ferguson and "Miami" John Cernuto then join the feature table action, as many poker pros hit the rail on Day 1B.

programme.title: Meli
programme.desc: Forced to take desperate measures to save her family, a young woman robs a stranger's home, unknowingly targeting someone far more dangerous.

programme.title: Bloodlines
programme.desc: Sydney Carter is a restless college student that has always felt out of place. When she discovers she's adopted, her world beings to unravel, and she embarks on a journey to discover her origins, but they come at a cost, and could destroy everything she's ever known.

programme.title: The Aftermath
programme.desc: After the new guy botches a perfectly planned armored car heist, four crafty criminals are left trapped, with the police closing in on them.

programme.title: Targeted
programme.desc: After escaping from a mental institution, a young woman secures a job that allows her to pursue her dangerous obsession with a crush from her past.

programme.title: Tainted
programme.desc: After growing up in an abusive home from her Mom, Desi continuously runs into problems with men treating her the way her Mom was.

programme.title: The Betrayal 3: Neva Ending
programme.desc: In this film, four different relationships display love, hurt, and betrayal, showing that not all friends are as loyal as you think.

programme.title: Mixed Christmas
programme.desc: Aurora wants to enjoy the holidays this year in some warmth and sunshine, and invites her three best friends to Miami for a Christmas trip to remember. When they arrive at their AirBnb, they discover it's been double booked by Aurora's ex-girlfriend and her new partner Axel. They have no choice but to combine their plans, and celebrate the holiday together.

programme.title: A True Christmas
programme.desc: Reminded of her past, Jessica can't stand Christmas, but this holiday season has several surprises in store that will help her create new memories.

programme.title: #Clout
programme.desc: Four stories unfold in Atlanta around the city's top influencers and their dependence on social media and their thirst for online prominence.

programme.title: Trapped in the Game: Fool Me Once
programme.desc: An FBI agent must navigate deception, crime, and moral compromise when presented with an opportunity that could provide a much-needed pay day.

programme.title: Christmas Family Ties
programme.desc: Two years after the death of her mother, Amaya pleads to Santa to bring her family together for Christmas like they used to. Her father David, having fallen out with his siblings after his own mother's death, decides to bring her to their ancestral family home for the holiday. Will they survive the holiday with their own family dysfunction and financial ruin hanging over their heads?

programme.title: A Wonderful Lie
programme.desc: When a fading romance author goes missing, a team of investigators piece together clues that ultimately lead them to a shocking discovery.

programme.title: A Matter of Heart
programme.desc: Balen, a successful family man, risks everything for a reckless affair. His wife, Krista, faces a harsh reality as her sacrifices are tested. Enter Latricia, a ruthless temptress with no shame. A story that weaves a tale of emotional turmoil, family crisis, unwavering faith, and the destructive power of temptation. Will love or lust prevail?

programme.title: The Barista
programme.desc: Brandon, a rising star in the podcast world, finds himself stalked and threatened by an obsessed fan, a barista named Paulette.

programme.title: Pinch
programme.desc: A self-centered thief has a sudden change of heart when he decides to help the poor.

programme.title: Platinum
programme.desc: After arriving in Houston, a man gets the opportunity of a lifetime when a business-savvy hooker names him Platinum and teaches him the pimp game.

programme.title: Princess of the Trap House
programme.desc: When a local drug dealer is arrested and put in jail, he asks his daughter Diamond to run his operation. However it doesn't sit well with the crew. Diamond must get rid of the disloyal members of the crew before they take control of the operation.

programme.title: One More Day
programme.desc: A photographer struggles to find a balance between staying afloat with her job and maintaining a healthy relationship with her teenage daughter.

programme.title: Stuck on Christmas
programme.desc: The competition for a major promotion is heating up between Synclaire and James, two ambitious rivals whose professional antagonism has spilled over into playful (and not-so-playful) pranks. But when a sudden malfunction leaves them both stranded in the company elevator on Christmas Eve, their race for the top becomes a desperate struggle for freedom.

programme.title: Restraining Orders
programme.desc: A married woman of 10 years, longs for a life of luxury and opulence. An old flame begins to catch her eye as a means to fulfill that dream, at the cost of her jealous husband. He begins to cause a storm of terror, where she fears for her safety.

programme.title: The Lying Truth
programme.desc: A rapper is accused of rape by a beautiful video vixen. He says he is innocent. One of them will be exposed as a liar when the truth is revealed.

programme.title: Broken Buckets
programme.desc: After serving 17 years in prison, Travis Cane returns home to rebuild his life and reconnect with his family. But his once bright son, Dontae is acting out and abandons his goals in basketball for a life on the streets.

programme.title: Money Gang Lit
programme.desc: Hakeem Benson, a down-on-his-luck videographer, is evicted and adrift. He takes a risky music video gig for Bull Dawg, a notorious kingpin. But when a respected gang member is murdered, Hakeem is falsely accused and targeted. Now, in a city on fire, he's fighting for his life and meaning amidst the chaos.

programme.title: Christmas for the Soul

programme.title: Heaven With a Gun
programme.desc: Jim Killian (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small Arizona town hoping to establish a peaceful life as the local preacher, but he soon finds himself in the middle of a feud between sheep ranchers and cattlemen. Leloopa (Barbara Hershey), a young Native American woman, pleads for Killian's help after her shepherd father is hung by Coke Beck (David Carradine), the vicious son of the head cattle rancher. Killian must weigh his actions carefully lest he perpetuate the cycle of retribution and revenge.

programme.title: The Last Challenge
programme.desc: Hotshot gunfighter Lot McGuire (Chad Everett) intends to make a name for himself by out-duelling legendary bandit-turned-lawman Marshal Dan Blaine (Glenn Ford). Before any bullets fly, however, Lot and his intended enemy strike up an unlikely friendship, and Blaine tries to convince the youngster to call off the shootout. Unfortunately, Lot can't be talked out of his quest for glory and so he guns down a few hostile locals, leaving Blaine no choice but to finally accept the offer for a showdown.

programme.title: Jeremiah Johnson
programme.desc: A Mexican-American War veteran, Jeremiah Johnson (Robert Redford), heads to the mountains to live in isolation. Woefully unequipped for the task at hand, Johnson is fortunate to come across a seasoned mountain man (Will Geer) willing to teach him the necessary survival tactics. As life continues in the mountains, Johnson finds himself a native bride (Delle Bolton) and an adopted son (Josh Albee). However, their peaceful existence is threatened when Johnson incurs the ire of the Crow Indians.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas tries to stop embittered John Holliver from venting his wrath on the people who expelled him from town years before.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Keith Douglas is met with a barrage of bullets as he opens his door. The police are looking to Dr. G for hard evidence to link certain suspects to the murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must decide if she can perform a successful autopsy without the deceased's organs. As she ponders the decision, we are given a rare glimpse into a different side of Dr. G's job.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There is work to be done in and around the pond this week, and Monty also begins planting out his dahlias. Adding zing to the month of May is the euphorbia, and Carol Klein visits Oxford Botanic garden to view their extensive collection.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on herbs which will grow happily in shade and has an unusual choice for his summer containers, bananas. Earlier this year, Monty paid a visit to Chatsworth House to find out about the history of the extensive grounds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty adds a touch of the exotic to the damp garden by planting a tree fern, and protects his new soft fruit garden from feathered predators with netting. Also Carol Klein selects hardy geraniums as her June `Plant of the Month'.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame joins Monty in Longmeadow and adds more medicinal planting to the herb garden, especially those that the bees love. Rachel also investigates how we can aid honey bee conservation and protect the nation's favourite pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don continues work in his courtyard, where he gives advice on plants which thrive on shady walls, sows root crops in the vegetable garden and catches up on work in his cottage garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.desc: WWE pro wrestling hall of fame legend Jake the Snake Roberts joins Nick in a no holds barred main event match against Jersey stripers during an incredible Raritan Bay run. Nick and Jake put the finishing moves down on bass, then Nick finds a monster bass bite on topwater poppers later in the day with good friends Bender and Drew Dog.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits the Crystal Coast of North Carolina to search out redfish and seatrout in the backwaters with Capt. Joe Tunstall and Capt. Chris Kimney.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everything—and the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and it’s bigger than ever. This time, we’re in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Florida’s most critical ecosystems. But it’s not just about hard work—it’s about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Don’t miss Part 1—where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Join Rush and his good friend Anthony Solmo for an epic day of fishing in the stunning waters of Key West, Florida! Leaving the Odyssea at the dock, they hop on a bay boat outfitted with a trolling motor for the ultimate inshore adventure. Gliding quietly through the shallows, they target a variety of species—including hard-pulling Tarpon and explosive topwater Jacks—leaving Rush thinking, “A guy could get used to this kind of fishing!”

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Ali’s home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma — chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and that’s exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head offshore to the Marathon Hump, taking advantage of the 26-feet hybrid boat's versatility to find some exciting Blackfin and Skipjack Tuna fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by scientist Nick Haddad, who educates our hosts and the fishing world on the various descending devices used to preserve stressed catch from deeper waters as the three of them get into some fun Red Snapper fishing off the coast of Marathon, Florida in the Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Rich's son Reed, who takes the wheel and directs the team into some amazing early morning baby tarpon fishing in the Everglades.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Hunter Smallback into the Everglades for some snook fishing, and the action really heats up when some hungry Lemon sharks crash the party.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch two thirds of a slam when they bring Tom’s new Yellowfin 24’ Bay up to Key Largo for some exciting flats fishing.

Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We are in Marathon, the heart of the Florida Keys, where crystal-clear waters meet charming island vibes. Known for its pristine dive sites, rich marine life, and welcoming locals, Marathon offers some of the best underwater adventures in the world.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: With human populations scattered through the landscape, human-wildlife conflict is a common occurrence in Borneo. Dan Cabela travels to the area to participate in an ambitious elephant collaring project, hoping to better understand how people and elephants can live harmoniously.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Chef Dave in the Golden Ilse to target Reds and Trout. Then head to Halyards to cook the catch.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The bond between and parent and child can grow in many ways, but nothing compares to the bond shared when hunting. The annual Father-Son hunt at FE Hill Outfitters has becoming a tradition for Heath and his son Gavin and in 2021, Gavin was able to take his largest buck to date, with his dad Heath behind the camera.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: They say you come to New Zealand as a stranger, but leave as family. In this episode of DIRT, the crew goes full circle—meeting Muttonbird chefs Emma and George on the South Island before hopping up to Raglan and working their way back down. Water skiing next to snow-capped mountains, cooking in hot springs the Māori way, and stargazing at Wairarapa Dark Sky Reserve are all on the itinerary. But it’s the final “Feed” done Kiwi-style that makes one thing clear—in this unique and stunning land, nobody’s a stranger for long.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: “Part of our responsibility as citizens in this country is to make sure we not only take care of these resources but we hand it off to the next generation in better condition that we found it.” -Bob Ziehmer, Senior Director of Conservation for Bass Pro Shops & Cabela's Join Bob in New Mexico as he talks about taking care of our natural resources for future generations. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Pentecost sets up a new stand on a creek crossing in Illinois that had been scouted for the past two years. It always heated up as the season progressed, and on his very first morning sit, the action unfolded fast. A good buck came cruising from the South in search of a doe. At 60 yards he started to turn away, but the Intimidator grunt call changed everything. With a few calls from the Intimidator, he spun around from 150 yards, worked a scrape at 40 yards, and walked right into range!

programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.desc: Josh and Alex Fogg The Coastal Resource Manager of Destin / Ft. Walton beach fish some of the artificial reefs that have been deployed over the past 20 years.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Capt Josh and Johnny from Johnny Jigs head out with gorgeous weather on their side to hit some reefs and put the jigs to work!

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: WWE pro wrestling hall of fame legend Jake the Snake Roberts joins Nick in a no holds barred main event match against Jersey stripers during an incredible Raritan Bay run. Nick and Jake put the finishing moves down on bass, then Nick finds a monster bass bite on topwater poppers later in the day with good friends Bender and Drew Dog.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits the Crystal Coast of North Carolina to search out redfish and seatrout in the backwaters with Capt. Joe Tunstall and Capt. Chris Kimney.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everything—and the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and it’s bigger than ever. This time, we’re in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Florida’s most critical ecosystems. But it’s not just about hard work—it’s about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Don’t miss Part 1—where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Join Rush and his good friend Anthony Solmo for an epic day of fishing in the stunning waters of Key West, Florida! Leaving the Odyssea at the dock, they hop on a bay boat outfitted with a trolling motor for the ultimate inshore adventure. Gliding quietly through the shallows, they target a variety of species—including hard-pulling Tarpon and explosive topwater Jacks—leaving Rush thinking, “A guy could get used to this kind of fishing!”

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Ali’s home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma — chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and that’s exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head offshore to the Marathon Hump, taking advantage of the 26-feet hybrid boat's versatility to find some exciting Blackfin and Skipjack Tuna fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by scientist Nick Haddad, who educates our hosts and the fishing world on the various descending devices used to preserve stressed catch from deeper waters as the three of them get into some fun Red Snapper fishing off the coast of Marathon, Florida in the Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Rich's son Reed, who takes the wheel and directs the team into some amazing early morning baby tarpon fishing in the Everglades.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Hunter Smallback into the Everglades for some snook fishing, and the action really heats up when some hungry Lemon sharks crash the party.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch two thirds of a slam when they bring Tom’s new Yellowfin 24’ Bay up to Key Largo for some exciting flats fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss and Captain James Hillman are heading out of Highland Park Fish Camp in Deland, Florida, looking for largemouth bass.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We are in Marathon, the heart of the Florida Keys, where crystal-clear waters meet charming island vibes. Known for its pristine dive sites, rich marine life, and welcoming locals, Marathon offers some of the best underwater adventures in the world.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: With human populations scattered through the landscape, human-wildlife conflict is a common occurrence in Borneo. Dan Cabela travels to the area to participate in an ambitious elephant collaring project, hoping to better understand how people and elephants can live harmoniously.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Chef Dave in the Golden Ilse to target Reds and Trout. Then head to Halyards to cook the catch.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Giant snook call this coastal town home. Watch along as Jay gets his hands on one.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Watch along as Jay learns to clean fish from ‪@reedthefishmonger‬. Watch the full video and learn to clean any fish.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Capt Josh and Johnny from Johnny Jigs head out with gorgeous weather on their side to hit some reefs and put the jigs to work!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The bond between and parent and child can grow in many ways, but nothing compares to the bond shared when hunting. The annual Father-Son hunt at FE Hill Outfitters has becoming a tradition for Heath and his son Gavin and in 2021, Gavin was able to take his largest buck to date, with his dad Heath behind the camera.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: They say you come to New Zealand as a stranger, but leave as family. In this episode of DIRT, the crew goes full circle—meeting Muttonbird chefs Emma and George on the South Island before hopping up to Raglan and working their way back down. Water skiing next to snow-capped mountains, cooking in hot springs the Māori way, and stargazing at Wairarapa Dark Sky Reserve are all on the itinerary. But it’s the final “Feed” done Kiwi-style that makes one thing clear—in this unique and stunning land, nobody’s a stranger for long.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: “Part of our responsibility as citizens in this country is to make sure we not only take care of these resources but we hand it off to the next generation in better condition that we found it.” -Bob Ziehmer, Senior Director of Conservation for Bass Pro Shops & Cabela's Join Bob in New Mexico as he talks about taking care of our natural resources for future generations. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: After a tough go at it in Oklahoma, Rigsby Stewart gets back to his home turf in East Georgia. This turkey gobbled his head off! Sweet redemption in the Georgia Pines!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Riley Green heads down to South Louisiana to finish out duck and deer season. The first morning duck hunt was absolutely epic with a 7 man limit at 7:35 am. Day 3 in the deer blind proved to be all Riley needed to close out his deer season with a big, wide 10 point!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Atlanta Braves' third baseman Austin Riley is usually spending his September and October holding it down on the hot corner in the MLB playoffs. Being that he can't hunt much during the early part of deer season, he usually hunts hard during December and January in Mississippi. This year was no different. He jumped at the opportunity to head down to the Backwoods testing grounds to hunt with the Small Town TV crew in Yazoo City. Austin capitalizes on a first sit opportunity on a true Mississippi giant over a Backwoods Attraction food plot! Three first sit bucks taken for the Road Trips crew at the Backwoods testing grounds!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Pentecost sets up a new stand on a creek crossing in Illinois that had been scouted for the past two years. It always heated up as the season progressed, and on his very first morning sit, the action unfolded fast. A good buck came cruising from the South in search of a doe. At 60 yards he started to turn away, but the Intimidator grunt call changed everything. With a few calls from the Intimidator, he spun around from 150 yards, worked a scrape at 40 yards, and walked right into range!
